Module swirlds.platform
Package com.swirlds.fs

Class FCFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirlds.fs.FCFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastCopyable, AutoCloseable
    public class FCFileSystem
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable, FastCopyable
    An advanced merkle tree optimized file system implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • flush

        public static void flush()
        Ensures that all pending transactions executed prior to the flush() method call are written to disk once the method completes. Any transactions or file system operations that began after the flush() method call are NOT guaranteed to be wriiten to disk. The state of the underlying file system and database are guaranteed to be consistent up to the point in time that flush() method was called.

        NOTE: This method is very slow and blocks all new database transactions and file system operations from executing while the pending transactions are being written to disk. The execution time of this method is bounded by the speed of the underlying host disk I/O subsystem and in most cases the method duration will be no less than 1 second and will have no upper bound.

        This method is automatically invoked by the Platform when saving the network state for restart and when preparing to enter a scheduled freeze window.

        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs

      • append

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void append​(byte[] content,
                   String path,
                   long modifyTimeSec,
                   long modifyTimeNs,
                   long expireTimeSec)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Appends content to end of an existing file specified by the path parameter. The file must exist or a PathNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        content - a byte array containing the data to be appended
        path - the location of file in the file system, must begin with a forward slash ("/")
        modifyTimeSec - the modification time in seconds since the unix epoch
        modifyTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of modifyTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the path parameter refers to a directory or the file does not exist
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path or content parameter is null, an empty string, or a zero-length array
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        fileAppend(String, byte[], long, int, long)

      • cp

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void cp​(String sourcePath,
               String destPath,
               long createTimeSec,
               long createTimeNs,
               long expireTimeSec,
               byte[] metadata)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Copies a file from the given sourcePath to a new file located at the given destPath location. The file specified by the sourcePath parameter must exist.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - the path to the file to be copied
        destPath - the path to which the file should be copied, must be the full path including the new file name
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the sourcePath parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        fileCopy(String, String, long, int, long, byte[])

      • fileCopy

        public void fileCopy​(String sourcePath,
                     String destPath,
                     long createTimeSec,
                     int createTimeNs,
                     long expireTimeSec,
                     byte[] metadata)
        Copies a file from the given sourcePath to a new file located at the given destPath location. The file specified by the sourcePath parameter must exist.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - the path to the file to be copied
        destPath - the path to which the file should be copied, must be the full path including the new file name
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the sourcePath parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the entire FCFileSystem along with all files and directories.
        Throws:
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs

      • deleteByExpiry

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void deleteByExpiry​(long beginTime,
                           long endTime)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Removes all files and directories with expiration times greater than or equal to beginTime and less than endTime. All times are given as seconds elapsed since the unix epoch.

        The beginTime and endTime parameters may be equal, however the endTime must never be less than the beginTime parameter.

        Parameters:
        beginTime - the bottom threshold for deletion, inclusive
        endTime - the top threshold for deletion, exclusive
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the beginTime parameter is greater than the endTime parameter
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        expiredDelete(long, long)

      • expiredDelete

        public void expiredDelete​(long beginTime,
                          long endTime)
        Removes all files and directories with expiration times greater than or equal to beginTime and less than endTime. All times are given as seconds elapsed since the unix epoch.

        The beginTime and endTime parameters may be equal, however the endTime must never be less than the beginTime parameter.

        Parameters:
        beginTime - the bottom threshold for deletion, inclusive
        endTime - the top threshold for deletion, exclusive
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the beginTime parameter is greater than the endTime parameter
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

      • deserializeEntity

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void deserializeEntity​(String destPath,
                              InputStream in,
                              long createTimeSec,
                              long createTimeNs,
                              long expireTimeSec,
                              byte[] metadata)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Recovers a file or directory that was previously serialized into a stream or byte array by the serialize(String, OutputStream) method. The destPath parameter must include the new directory or file name to be created at the target location. All elements of the given destPath parameter must exist except for the last path element which is the new file or directory to be created.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        destPath - the path at which to reconstruct the serialized data including the name of the new file or directory to be created
        in - the input stream containing the serialized data
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file or directory (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        deserialize(String, InputStream, long, int, long, byte[])

      • deserialize

        public void deserialize​(String destPath,
                        InputStream in,
                        long createTimeSec,
                        int createTimeNs,
                        long expireTimeSec,
                        byte[] metadata)
        Recovers a file or directory that was previously serialized into a stream or byte array by the serialize(String, OutputStream) method. The destPath parameter must include the new directory or file name to be created at the target location. All elements of the given destPath parameter must exist except for the last path element which is the new file or directory to be created.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        destPath - the path at which to reconstruct the serialized data including the name of the new file or directory to be created
        in - the input stream containing the serialized data
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file or directory (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

The path parameter must include the new file name to be created at the target location. All elements of the given path parameter must exist except for the last path element which is the new file to be created.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:

        content - the file content to be stored
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:

        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs

      • fileCreate

        public void fileCreate​(String path,
                       byte[] content,
                       long createTimeSec,
                       int createTimeNs,
                       long expireTimeSec,
                       byte[] metadata)
        Creates a new file or overwrites an existing file specified by the path parameter with the given file contents. The path parameter must include the new file name to be created at the target location. All elements of the given path parameter must exist except for the last path element which is the new file to be created.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        path - the path in the FCFileSystem instance where the new file should be created including the new filename
        content - the file content to be stored
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

      • ensureDirectoriesExist

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void ensureDirectoriesExist​(String path,
                                   long createTimeSec,
                                   long createTimeNs,
                                   long expireTimeSec)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Creates all directories recursively in the given path if they do not already exist.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be created if it does not exist
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is empty, invalid, or does not begin with a forward slash ("/")
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        directoriesCreate(String, long, int, long)

      • directoriesCreate

        public void directoriesCreate​(String path,
                              long createTimeSec,
                              int createTimeNs,
                              long expireTimeSec)
        Creates all directories recursively in the given path if they do not already exist.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to be created if it does not exist
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is empty, invalid, or does not begin with a forward slash ("/")
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

      • getExpiringMetadata

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public List<byte[]> getExpiringMetadata​(long beginTime,
                                        long endTime)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Returns the metadata byte arrays for all files and directories with expiration times greater than or equal to beginTime and less than endTime. All times are given as seconds elapsed since the unix epoch.

        The beginTime and endTime parameters may be equal, however the endTime must never be less than the beginTime parameter.

        Parameters:
        beginTime - the bottom threshold for deletion, inclusive
        endTime - the top threshold for deletion, exclusive
        Returns:
        the List of metadata for all expired files and directories
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the beginTime parameter is greater than the endTime parameter
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        expiredMetadata(long, long)

                                    long endTime)

        The beginTime and endTime parameters may be equal, however the endTime must never be less than the beginTime parameter.

        Parameters:
        beginTime - the bottom threshold for deletion, inclusive
        endTime - the top threshold for deletion, exclusive

        the List of metadata for all expired files and directories

        IllegalArgumentException - if the beginTime parameter is greater than the endTime parameter
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted

      • importRec

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void importRec​(String destPath,
                      String sourcePath,
                      long createTimeSec,
                      long createTimeNs,
                      long expireTimeSec,
                      byte[] metadata)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Imports a file or directory contained on the underlying host filesystem to a path in this FCFileSystem instance. The destPath parameter must include new directory or file name to be created at the target location. All elements of the given destPath parameter must exist except for the last path element which is the new file or directory to be created.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - the source file or directory located on the underlying host filesystem
        destPath - the path in this FCFileSystem instance to which the file should be copied, must be the full path including the new file or directory name
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PhysicalPathNotFoundException - if the sourcePath on the underlying host filesystem does not exist
        PathNotFoundException - if the destPath, except for the last element, does not exist in this FCFileSystem instance
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        fileImport(String, String, long, int, long, byte[])

      • fileImport

        public void fileImport​(String sourcePath,
                       String destPath,
                       long createTimeSec,
                       int createTimeNs,
                       long expireTimeSec,
                       byte[] metadata)
        Imports a file or directory contained on the underlying host filesystem to a path in this FCFileSystem instance.         This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - the source file or directory located on the underlying host filesystem
        destPath - the path in this FCFileSystem instance to which the file should be copied, must be the full path including the new file or directory name
        createTimeSec - the creation time in seconds since the unix epoch
        createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second
        expireTimeSec - the expiration time in seconds since the unix epoch
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PhysicalPathNotFoundException - if the sourcePath on the underlying host filesystem does not exist
        PathNotFoundException - if the destPath, except for the last element, does not exist in this FCFileSystem instance
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy

        FileSystemException - if an error occurs

      • isDir

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public boolean isDir​(String path)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Checks for the existence of a given absolute FCFileSystem path that represents a directory.

        Returns true only if the path exists and is a directory. If the path exists but represents a file this will always return false. Use fileExists(String) to determine if the path exists and is a file.

        Parameters:
        path - the fully qualified, absolute FCFileSystem path
        Returns:
        true if the path exists and is a directory, otherwise false
        Throws:
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        directoryExists(String), fileExists(String)

The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted.         createTimeNs - the nanoseconds elapsed since the beginning of createTimeSec second

        Reads the contents of the file located at the given absolute path and returns the entire file as an array of bytes. If the given path is a directory then a IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        path - the fully qualified, absolute FCFileSystem path
        Returns:
        the full file contents
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the path parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalStateException - if the path parameter refers to a directory
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16

      • slurpS

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public String slurpS​(String path)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Reads the contents of the file located at the given absolute path and returns the entire file as an ASCII String. If the given path is a directory then a IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        path - the fully qualified, absolute FCFileSystem path
        Returns:
        the full file contents as an ASCII String
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the path parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalStateException - if the path parameter refers to a directory
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        fileRead(String)

      • updateMetadata

        @Deprecated(since="18.11.16",
            forRemoval=true)
public void updateMetadata​(String path,
                           byte[] metadata)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Updates the application provided metadata for the file or directory specified by the path parameter.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        path - the fully qualified, absolute FCFileSystem path
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the path parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        metadataUpdate(String, byte[])

      • metadataUpdate

        public void metadataUpdate​(String path,
                           byte[] metadata)
        Updates the application provided metadata for the file or directory specified by the path parameter.

        This method accepts an optional metadata parameter that may contain up to 100 bytes of arbitrary data. This arbitrary data will be returned to the application when calling the expiredMetadata(long, long) method. The application can choose to renew any files or directories that are expired based on the returned list of metadata elements. Once the application has renewed (or chosen to not renew) one or more of the expired files/directories, the application should then call the expiredDelete(long, long) method to ensure the expired files are properly deleted. For example, an application might use the metadata field to store a unique identifier such as an account number with each file or directory it creates. When the file expires the application can then choose whether to renew the file/directory expiration time based on the funds contained in the account.

        Parameters:
        path - the fully qualified, absolute FCFileSystem path
        metadata - metadata to be included with the destination file (maximum of 100 bytes), may be null
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if the path parameter refers to a file that does not exist
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path parameter is null or an empty string
        ImmutableFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is an immutable copy
        DeletedFileSystemException - if this FCFileSystem instance is deleted
        FileSystemException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        18.11.16
